perturbation.original_text: (b) Subject to Section 7(d), the Servicer may resign its duties hereunder by providing the Owner with at least 60 days' prior written notice.

perturbation.original_text:
(c) Subject to Section 7(d), and subject to the prior written consent of the Agent so long as the Loan Agreement remains outstanding, the Owner may remove the Servicer immediately upon written notice of termination from the Owner to the Servicer if any of the following events shall occur (each, a "Servicer Termination Right - Owner"):

(i) the Servicer shall default in the performance of any of its duties under this Agreement and, after notice of such default, shall not cure such default within 30 days (or, if such default cannot be cured in such time, shall not give within 30 days such assurance of cure as shall be reasonably satisfactory to the Owner); or
perturbation.changed_text:
(c) Subject to Section 7(d), and subject to the prior written consent of the Agent so long as the Loan Agreement remains outstanding, the Owner may remove the Servicer immediately upon written notice of termination from the Owner to the Servicer if any of the following events shall occur (each, a "Servicer Termination Right - Owner"):

(i) the Servicer shall default in the performance of any of its duties under this Agreement and, after notice of such default, shall not cure such default within 10 days (or, if such default cannot be cured in such time, shall not give within 10 days such assurance of cure as shall be reasonably satisfactory to the Owner); or
perturbation.explanation: The original text gives a 30-day cure period for defaults. Reducing this to 10 days is unreasonably short, potentially violating principles of good faith and fair dealing, and may contradict state laws about providing reasonable opportunity to cure breaches of contract.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing in contract law; some state laws may imply minimum cure periods for contractual breaches.

perturbation.original_text: The Servicer agrees that if any of the events specified in clause (ii) of this Section 7(c) shall occur, it shall give written notice thereof to the Owner within seven (7) days after the occurrence of such event.
perturbation.changed_text: The Servicer agrees that if any of the events specified in clause (ii) of this Section 7(c) shall occur, it shall give written notice thereof to the Owner within fifteen (15) days after the occurrence of such event.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates a 7-day notice period to the owner when a major adverse event (like bankruptcy) occurs that could trigger termination.
